jx.jx_en_mean: (chiefly of a boat) turn upside down

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: apparently an alteration of French tortue (see tortoise)

entry.def: A turtle is a large reptile which has a thick shell covering its body and which lives in the sea most of the time.
A turtle is any reptile that has a thick shell around its body, for example a tortoise or terrapin.
If a boat turns turtle, it turns upside down when it is in the water.

example.ex: The tug nearly turned turtle twice, but I managed to keep her upright.
example.tran: 拖船两次都差点翻个儿，但我设法稳住了船身。

means.word_mean: 1. any of various aquatic and land reptiles having a bony shell and flipper-like limbs for swimming

sentences.sentence: "Don't rock the boat or it will capsize!"

means.word_mean: 2. hunt for turtles, especially as an occupation
